resources.string: The Shattered Mountain

Yash Zafar's investigations into Shattered Mountain have uncovered signs that the Corrupted took an unusual interest in finding and imprisoning a specific individual. Search for this mysterious person and determine if they could be an ally in your fight against the Tempest.
Commander Thorpe's defeat weakened the Corrupted significantly in Great Cleave, and our positions have grown stronger.
"We should push the advantage."
I was hoping you'd say this, so I took the liberty of ordering scouts to venture closer to the foot of the Shattered Mountain.
Working with the rangers, I believe we've found outposts not far from the mountain itself, the heart of the Tempest's domain.
"We're in striking distance."
Well, not yet. Wardens are securing those locations as we speak, but we are still grievously outnumbered.
We could use a hero like you on the front lines. Rather than bring Wardens to you, I would bring you to the Wardens.
"Alright, let's go."
Excellent! I will inform the others and then meet you on the southwestern road that leads into Shattered Mountain. Until then!
I'll see you on the road to Shattered Mountain.
God's mercy, it's you! Let's get out of here.
I'll see you on the road to Shattered Mountain.
Here we are, then. The edge of the Tempest's domain... the Shattered Mountain beyond. If only Yonas could have seen this…
Here we are, then. The threshold of the Tempest's domain... If only Yonas could have seen this…
"He would be proud, Yash."
Yes, and ready to charge into battle, always. I cannot say as much for our forces currently. Our positions are tenuous, at best.
We need to fortify the outpost, but first, something to investigate - a prisoner the Corrupted are holding nearby.
"Who is this prisoner?"
We don't know, but they've attracted much attention. I'll leave it to you how to proceed, and I will meet you at the outpost.

After a century of being away from this infernal island, I had forgotten the tension that permeates the air on Aeternum. It's invigorating, but there's also a cloying quality to it. It feels like one's constantly trading clarity and hope for this gift of eternal life. Perhaps this is why mankind was never worthy of such a thing. In the decades since I departed, Isabella has been busy and her demon armies now dominate the land. My plans may have been hindered upon arrival, but I will find a way to make amends for my sins... or let me be damned as well.

Again, repetition of similar phrasing! Always conjugation of "to give" or at times imperative! "For by grace you are saved through faith: and that not of yourselves, for it is the GIFT OF GOD." The Ancient Glyphs in another passage are marred, but the translation could very well be: "GRAIN OF GOD" or "WINE OF GOD". Dative cases and other related forms seem the most prevalent! Cross-check the subject, is it always divine? Is the divine ever accusative? Clearly the path to Isabella de Leon!
God's mercy, it's you! Let's get out of here.
I knew this moment would come. That you'd be drawn here like a moth to flame, your light to shine in the darkness.
"Do I know you?"
Yes. Captain Thorpe failed us... his greed sabotaged our safe passage, and set our souls on this course. Do you remember now?
"You’re the priest who guided us."
And my guidance has remained with you, whether you realize it or not. For good or for evil, our fates are intertwined.
You seek Isabella, and though my path has been twisted by steel and thorn, I traveled the same road, for the same purpose.
"You seek to defeat Isabella?"
I seek to atone for my sins and those I caused others to commit. My journal is my testament. Read it, if you will.
The journal is open to the passage you should read.
I still recall the day I discovered an Angel visiting my church….
Isabella de Leon, a young woman of unsurpassed devotion, seeking redemption for generations of family shame.
It was I who first brought her to hear the mad ravings of the Heretic…
And strangely found myself joining their ill-fated expedition.
On Aeternum, Isabella's aspiration became obsession…
And when she drank from the Fountain, her thirst for divine inspiration transformed into madness.
As the crimson thickened in her eyes, so did the hold of the demonic parasite within her soul.
She met the crew's questions with blood, leaving them as mindless husks.
My heart shattered, my faith lost… I struck down the Heretic for leading us to this damnation…
And I fled in shame to the Old World, determined to return and make this right.
In Rome, I gained access to the darkest archives of my order…
And there found answers that promised salvation when I returned to these shores.
I hired a Captain to bring me back, but after shipwrecking on the island,
I saw what happened… the blessing I intended for her was bestowed upon you instead.
Now you know. My life was restored just in time to witness my holy mission thwarted, my only hope that we would meet again.
Continue
I came here seeking insight into Isabella's affairs, but discovered little and found myself captured and tortured by her pawns.
"Have you seen her?"
No. Though she was undoubtedly aware of my capture, she avoided coming here... which tells us a great deal, I believe.
But I fear we tarry too long. This stronghold is dangerous. Come, there is an old fort nearby where we can talk further.
But I fear we tarry too long. This camp is unsafe. Come, there is an old fort nearby where we can talk further.
I did not expect friendly welcome nor Corruption beaten back, but you and your fellow Soulwardens have accomplished much.
(Optional) Use the Spirit Shrine
Follow Yash to Shattered Mountain
Receive information from Yash before entering Shattered Mountain
Search the camp for information about the Prisoner
Read the notes left by the Prisoner
Follow the tracks to find where the Prisoner was taken
Infiltrate {POITags} to find Father Russo
Find the Prisoner's Cell in {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} to collect the Key to the Prison Cell
Open the Door to Rescue the Prisoner
Speak with the Freed Prisoner
Read Father Russo's Journal
Speak with Father Russo
Rejoin Father Russo at the Outpost
Through a Mirror Darkly
Father Russo is convinced from your account that a spark of goodness still exists within the Tempest. Gather relics saturated with her past emotions from the time before she fell to Corruption.
Your comrades have confided to me some of your story. They say Isabella was making a game of tormenting you.
"Our minds are bound somehow."
Oh...? Good Lord… that's the answer! If we can access her thoughts, we can rouse the emotions she tries to suppress!
We must test the limits of this connection between you. This is the way Isabella de Leon may yet be redeemed!
"Redeemed?"
Yes! Don’t you see? This is WHY we are here. We can use this bond between you to force her attention on the past.
Memories from BEFORE her fall… at the very least, these will weaken Corruption's hold and put Isabella on the defensive.
"Alright. You have a plan?"
I do. Prior to my capture, I discovered where she hid the relics of her past - taking care to ensure she won't be reminded.
An old fort, an abandoned town, and that loathsome mine. You must recover these relics while I study the way we might use them.
An abandoned town, a loathsome mine, and that infernal fountain where this all began…
You must recover these relics while I study the way we might use them.
Go quickly. Isabella is on the verge of eternal damnation - and dragging the rest of the world with her.
You have done well. These objects harbor powerful echoes from Isabella's past, when she still had some trace of innocence.
Collect relics from Isabella's past:
Recover Isabella's Brooch from {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from {POITags}
Recover Isabella's Logbook from {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from {POITags}
Recover Isabella's Chalice from {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from {POITags}
Wisdom and Madness and Folly

With the collection of the relics, Father Russo wishes to psychically attack the Tempest with her own memories and feelings. Join him atop the nearby vista in view of the Tempest's stronghold, and strike back at her with all of your power.
Now, you must simply open yourself up to her awareness, and let us see how she reacts to such a psychic assault.
"I've blocked her out of my mind."
Oh… but of course you have. Still, if you're the one who erected these mental barriers, you can surely lower them as well.
Follow me into the cliffs to the east where we will find a place you can settle your mind. Have faith, you can do this.
She may try to resist, but you alone can reach that goodness which remains. I believe in you, Soulwarden.
It worries me - the Corrupted are aware of our presence, but they do not attack.
Here, now. Still your mind, release the fears she stirred up within you, and invite her to trespass into your mind once more.
"I'll try."
That is all I ask. Let us begin - I will read aloud passages related to her past. Words she once loved.
While I read, touch the relic most relevant to the passage. Let her feel through you, and we may yet rekindle her light.
She may try to resist, but you alone can reach that goodness which remains. I believe in you, Soulwarden.
Ah, at last our bond is renewed, and… wait, what is this?
Ah, at last our bond is renewed, and… wait, what is this?
"We see through a glass in a dark manner: but then, face to face."
"We see through a glass in a dark manner: but then, face to face."
I need no mirror to know myself! My will is my triumph!
I need no mirror to know myself! My will is my triumph!
"Judged by those things written in the books, according to their deeds."
"Judged by those things written in the books, according to their deeds."
No! All I held dear was drowned in shame, but Corruption washes me clean!
No! All I held dear was drowned in shame, but Corruption washes me clean!
"My Father, let this chalice pass from me, yet not as I will, but as you will."
"My Father, let this chalice pass from me, yet not as I will, but as you will."
I will not surrender the chalice… enough! Our bond is severed!
I will not surrender the chalice… enough! Our bond is severed!
We have done it! If those relics meant nothing to her, as she claimed, she would not have reacted as she did. This is good news.
"She's blocked me out now."
Yes, but we have proven today that she can be reached. It will only be a matter of forcing the channel open once again.
Your comrades clamor for your attention to military matters, so let us speak again later, after I've had time to think.
Warden, I would speak with you further, when you have time.
The prisoner seems to have captured all your attention since you arrived. Does he have insights related to our strategy here?
"Nothing solid, yet."
That's a shame. I would welcome counsel. It worries me - the Corrupted are aware of our presence, but they do not attack.
Follow the trail up to Father Russo
Meet Father Russo by the altars he set up
Talk with Father Russo about the ritual
Open your mind to Isabella
Use Isabella's emotions against her
Use Isabella's emotions against her
Use Isabella's emotions against her
Touch the relic most relevant to the passage.
The wrong relic was touched...
You selected wisely...
Listen closely to Father Russo's clue
Listen to Isabella's reaction
Meet with Father Russo
Talk to Father Russo about your meditation
Return to {POITags}
Marched Across the Land

Now that Isabella has been wounded and frightened, it is time to secure enough allies that can overcome the defenses of Myrkgard. Yash Zafar has heard rumors that Morgaine is in trouble; search Edengrove and bring her back to the safety of the Soulwarden encampment.
Don't get me wrong, I'm grateful they're ignoring us for now. It buys us time to fortify our defenses, but is that enough?
"We need more allies."
Agreed. Sun Fuchun promised she would send aid from Ebonscale, but I also hoped we could re-enlist the Sorceress Morgaine.
I sent a messenger to Caliburne, but they returned with only vague rumors and secondhand sightings. Some say she's gone mad.
"I'll follow up on these rumors."
Please do! While I have never felt entirely comfortable around her, I recognize the sorceress is an asset to the Order.
In the meantime, I'll rally the wardens and rangers. We've set up another outpost to the east - we should meet there.

string.comment: Phaeris's verbal cadence should be reminiscient of the way Myrtilus speaks. But, rather than pausing in thought as her sister, Phaeris could be pausing and then rushing ahead a bit. Like she's the 'energetic younger twin sister' of the two.
string.speaker: Phaeris
string.name: PeacemakerPhaeris

resources.string: Oh. A human is come. We give to you warning that there is much madness here. An infection wide as branches spreading.
"Why is my friend held prisoner?"
Your passions are akin to Angry Earth. This is disquieting. You mistake our intention? This human is hurt. I… WE mend.
Found her, raving in the forest… and weeping. We think she has contracted Angry Earth Sickness. Please, help us help her.
"Alright, but can I trust you?"

string.comment: First sentence is spoken to her sister Myrtilus via hivemind-speak. The rest spoken to the player.
string.speaker: Phaeris
string.name: PeacemakerPhaeris

resources.string: ::.Yes, Sister, we are patient.:: Human, we are Peacemaker, Phaeris. Where strife avails not, we come to nurture.
Cure for human friend is there, within this cave. Some of our kind guard it jealously, though they cannot cure themselves.
"I'll fight them if I must."
You must. Gather Amber Lichen, sparkling like sunbeams on crusty rock, then come. We take… Mora-gaen to more peaceful climes.
It worries me - the Corrupted are aware of our presence, but they do not attack.
The human friend shall be safer by the waterside.

string.comment: Spoken in her half-madness. She isn't very aware of what's going on around her.
string.speaker: Morgaine
string.name: SorceressMorgain

resources.string: Myrddin, come back! I don't understand. How can that save anyone? They hate us all. And I am too weak. Brother… Brother!
Find out why Morgaine is with an Angry Earth
Myrddin, come back! I don't understand. How can that save anyone? They hate us all. And I am too weak. Brother… Brother!
"Morgaine! What happened to you?"
Did you transpose through the greensie passage? We are fascinated by it, though it tickles our bark we find.
"I have the Amber Lichen."
Yes, we are applying the lichen. Our contact with humans is limited. We forget they live their lives in much haste.
Oh. The fog is lifting from her eyes, but how Mora-gaen moans now. It wounds me to hear. I... WE are sorry for this hurt.
"Can you ease her pain?"
Certain mosses can help in dulling strong sensation. Those in the Cloud Garden are correct. Go, we will comfort.

string.comment: Not her normal prickliness or anger throughout. She is in emotional pain, and much grief, and is probably trying to mask that from a human. Sad as fuck. Lonely. Withdrawn and overwhelmed by an impossible task of healing what was blighted.
string.speaker: Adiana
string.name: AdianaTheron

resources.string: You…? Tell me, is it hubris or stupidity that brings you before me once again?
"… probably stupidity."
Or is it that you've come to gloat? Humans do so love to spit upon the suffering of others.
"I'm here for Cloud Moss, Adiana."
Of course you are. With one hand, you stab nature in the back, and with the other you steal its blessings.
You are not worthy of my time. The anguish you've caused is unthinkable. See it for yourself in the north. Begone…

string.comment: Very withdrawn and sad.
string.speaker: Adiana
string.name: AdianaTheron

resources.string: Go, human, and trouble me no more.

string.comment: Very withdrawn and sad.
string.speaker: Adiana
string.name: AdianaTheron

resources.string: Go, human, and speak to me no more.

string.comment: Very withdrawn and sad.
string.speaker: Adiana
string.name: AdianaTheron

resources.string: Go, human, and trouble me no more.
Ohh…ohh... Huntress is unhappy... so so sad. She says you are trespasser, she wishes you to leave right away.
"I'll leave when my friend leaves."
Oh, I… WE understand! We scent Cloud Moss upon you, what Mora-gaen needs, give it and she will be well, and we are pleased.
We Phaeris will remain friend, even if Huntress will not. We are Peacemaker, Phaeris. We come to nurture.
Humans... such peculiar names. We wonder why?
What in hell's fury has happened? Soulwarden! Where are we? Guh! My head is splitting at the seams!
"You were quite sick."
Sick? Nonsense! I remember, I was... worried, that's all, worried for my brother, and… for Aeternum. And something else…
Oh! That's it! The Angry Earth! Myrddin said we need them to defeat the Corrupted! But… they were not receptive.
"Adiana is mad. The Motherwell…"
Ah, yes. We defiled it to cleanse Myrddin's staff… heh! Just like my brother, offer a solution he's already rendered impossible!
But it's not just Myrddin! My research proved the Angry Earth harbor some power against Corruption. We must use it!
"That won't be easy."
Surely there's some way. This one, the healer, she seems… different somehow. We can at least ask her, can't we?
Go on, go on. Despite her appearances, I sense she is quite kind. She may be receptive.
Huntress urges from afar for you to go, but we would not resort to force. We are Phaeris, we nurture the sick, and the well.
"Do you know what Corruption is?"
Oh… oh! The crimson poison... we know it well. Fighting this is how our sistren and brethren become Blighted.
We cannot heal Blight. We want to help, but cannot hear. Blighted ones are severed… Huntress says only good for fighting now.
"Can they fight the Corrupted?"
Oh, yes. Huntress wills that we shepherd Blighted sistren and brethren north to stand against shadow of the mountain.
"Then, Morgaine and I will help."
Ahhh, you will help us? I… WE thank you. Let us go. We plant pheromones alongside the road, and the Blighted will follow.
Hah! Our "woodsie friend" is quite the travel companion. Chatty as a magpie, turns out. Odd, but charming.
This rocky shelter on the edge of the woodlands is the destination we seek.
Our Blighted brethren and sistren come, but we cannot hear them. Their madness is not like that of the human friend.
Search for Morgaine in Edengrove
Question the Angry Earth about Morgaine
Collect {itemName} to cure Morgaine
(Optional) Travel to Phaeris via the Teleporter
Bring the ingredients to Phaeris
Talk to Phaeris about how to cure Morgaine
Travel to the Cloud Garden
(Optional) Talk to Adiana Theron
Collect {itemName} to cure Morgaine
Take the Cloud Moss to Phaeris
Discuss the cure with Phaeris
Take the cure to Morgaine
Talk to Phaeris
Place the first Peacemaker Pheromones
Place the second Peacemaker Pheromones
Place the third Peacemaker Pheromones
Place the final Peacemaker Pheromones
The Harvest is Come

Morgaine has returned to her senses after being helped by the Angry Earth Peacemaker. Phaeris provides a surprising opportunity for the Soulwardens to secure Blighted forces in the upcoming battle against the Tempest. Create a connection between Phaeris and the Blighted Angry Earth so they can communicate.
Mora-gaen is very wise when she walks and talks with us. She asks if Blighted brethren can do more, make war with Corrupted.
“We'll need allies for the attack.”
We cannot ask Blighted to fight with you, because we cannot hear their song… here, in this place, my song is alone.
On… on our travels, Mora-gaen said she lost great knowledge here, notes… notes about Blight. Clues to hearing them again, we wonder?
"I'll recover those notes for her."
We do not entirely understand this thing. Nevertheless, we will wait here and ensure she is in comfort.
Yes, speak to the human friend. She is tired from travels... but her wisdom can aid us, aid the Blighted sistren and brethren.

string.comment: Morgaine wrote this in her madness.
string.speaker: Morgaine
string.name: SorceressMorgain

resources.string: Exhibit cooperative reactions clear to not commune communicate on deep. AE drive away. Cull the herd no actual culling heard. Hard to say. Zero violence AE to B. Much violence B to C. Rabid dogs to starving cat. Powerful ally allaying no discernable however. Near dusk fungus Blighted congregate. At fungus? Are fungus? Near! At seems time insensate. Whispering? Recharging? Myrddin was right.

string.comment: This is an ALT in case we didn't want her notes to be written in madness. Probably don't need to record this now, but leaving here if you have more time in VO.
string.speaker: Morgaine
string.name: SorceressMorgain

resources.string: The Blighted exhibit cooperative reactions to one another, but it is clear that they are not communicating on the deeper level of their unaffected counterparts. In fact, I have even seen the Angry Earth driving them away. Culling the herd without actual culling? Hard to say. But while violence never breaks out between these two groups, I have witnessed often the Blighted (heh) falling upon Corrupted like rabid dogs on a starving cat. Myrddin was right. A powerful ally! They exhibit no discernable communication with one another in the field. Yet near dusk, they tend to congregate around clusters of Blighted Fungus. At that time, they merely seem insensate to me. What are they doing? "Whispering" to each other? "Recharging" their energy to the coming day?
I am tired, Soulwarden, but my wits being about me again, I recall... I came here for the Blighted Angry Earth. But why?
"Maybe this note will remind you."
Give it here. Oh, what is this nonsense! Deciphering my own notes is sometimes as difficult as understanding my brother!
Bah! These are like Myrddin's attempts at… Always riddles and— Now this seems to have potential. "Near dusk… congregate…"
Apparently the Blighted cluster together around the fungus near the end of each day. Perhaps this is their way of talking?
"Could Phaeris hear them this way?"
Perhaps! They cannot commune with the hivemind, but a more localized spore system might yield results!
I am putting too much guesswork into this, but… yes, try the formula. It's worth the attempt to confirm our conjecture.
Yes, speak to the human friend. She is tired from travels... but her wisdom can aid us, aid the Blighted sistren and brethren.
We are on the verge of some discovery. Nonetheless, I'll be damned if I know what it is.
Not my most elegant work. Still, it's something.

string.comment: Talking to two of her siblings via hivemind-speak.
string.speaker: Phaeris
string.name: PeacemakerPhaeris

resources.string: Ohh! What is this? ::.Little sister! Yes, we do! And brother! We hear you. Yes, yes, do not weep, we are here now.::
"Can they help us in the battle?"
I… WE will ask. The connection is unstable, but I will persevere and try to express "War" and "Corrupted". It will take time.
Human friend Mora-gaen has given us her note with other words. How strange that your songs are made of paper?
"I must go to the nearby outpost."
More human friends to be gathered? Yes, they are your family. I… WE will find you later once we are successful here.
We tried to tell Huntress of what we do, but she does not respond. Sister Myrtilus did; we are very grateful.
We cannot let up. Assaulting the mountain will require great preparation... and great sacrifice, I fear.
I cannot believe I'm saying this, but it's actually a relief to be back in human society. No offense to Phaeris, she's quite nice.
Young Yash shared the gruesome details of Caer Dun. I am sorry for your loss, Soulwarden, and that I was not there…
Find and Read Morgaine's Notes
Discuss the cryptic notes with Morgaine
Collect {itemName}
Defeat {targetName} to collect {itemName}
Craft the Blightbane Spore Sac at your Camp
Use the Blightbane Spore Sac against the Blighted Dryads
Confirm that Phaeris now hears the Blighted
Meet Morgaine in {POITags}
Angel That Brings Death

Morgaine is concerned that even with Blighted Angry Earth on their side, the Soulwardens remain at a strategic disadvantage. After being reminded of her ability in Weaver's Fen to command the Lost, she will attempt to exert her will over the Ancient Guardians in the nearby cavern to further bolster your forces.
As we've both witnessed, dwelling in the past can be detrimental to one's soul, so let us focus on the task at hand.
"We need more allies."
The city on the mountain is called Myrkgard, as imposing as it is well-protected. It will take some army to breach its defenses.
If we were back in the Fen, I could rally many of the Lost to our cause, but here, there are only Corrupted and mindless Ancient Guardians.
"Why not Ancient Guardians...?"
… I've never considered such a thing, but my methods of commanding the Lost are derived from sorcery that directs the Guardians.
I suppose it's worth a try, isn't it? An army of Guardians would expand our ranks significantly, and there are ruins here.
"Just tell me what you need."
Hah! What I really need now is a warm bath! But I suppose I must act my age. The truth is, I already have what we need.
Venture into the caverns nearby and affix these attuned crystals as a relay, then we shall see if the Guardians answer my call.
I have mixed feelings, Soulwarden. If this works, there's an outstanding wager I'll owe my brother.
You mustn't look so surprised. I wasn't about to send soldiers and not accompany them myself.
I have mixed feelings, Soulwarden. If this works, there's an outstanding wager I'll owe my brother.
I can feel the winds of change blowing. Like the hand of Yonas on our backs, pushing us along to victory!
Continue
If your ploy with the Angry Earth yields results, and Morgaine's gambit pays off, we'll have a large… and rather eclectic army.
Greetings, Soulwarden. On behalf of Emperor-in-Waiting Zhou Liang, I have come to offer the Dynasty's assistance to your cause.
Talk to Yash about gathering allies
Travel to {POITags} to place the Augmentation Crystals for Morgaine
Set up Morgaine's crystal relay:
Defeat Ancient Guardians
Place the north Augmentation Crystal
Place the east Augmentation Crystal
Place the south Augmentation Crystal
Place the west Augmentation Crystal
Meet up with the Soulwarden's Envoy
As Black as Sackcloth

At the behest of Emperor-in-Waiting Zhou Liang, Sun Fuchun has come to Shattered Mountain to offer support. She requires a special ingredient to concoct war-grade smoke bombs that will both distract the Corrupted and prevent reinforcements from flanking the Soulwardens during the imminent assault on Myrkgard.
And on a personal note, I am glad to be here, both to see my friends, and to contribute in striking back against our vile enemy.
"I'm happy you'll be joining us."
Good, because I need someone I can depend on. I've got a plan, but I could use some help.
I raided the Dynasty weapon stores, and have procured armaments for our assault - which I think the Tempest will not be expecting.
"That sounds promising."
It is! These are smoke bombs, not just common fireworks, mind you, but the kind that can envelop entire cities.
For the bombs to be effective against the Corrupted, I require a rather grisly substance... pus extracted from Corruption Barbs.
"Um. You want me to gather… pus?"
I know we've played this game before, but it's worked well so far. I need your strength while I prepare things here.
Normally, I'd feel a bit overwhelmed being in such a dark place. Yet, I feel oddly exhilarated and in control.
Normally, I'd feel a bit overwhelmed being in such a dark place. Yet, I feel oddly exhilarated and in control.
I told you I'd find you again, Soulwarden, and here I am. We must speak, and soon.

string.comment: Responding to the gross smell of the Corruption Pus. Last sentence could be her trying to convince herself, under a breath.
string.speaker: Sun Fuchun
string.name: AlchemistSun

resources.string: Oh my. That is rather potent, isn't it? Well. Pus we need, so pus we shall use. Alchemy isn't always herbs and spices.
Continue
Admittedly, this is more concentrated than I presupposed. I'll have to adjust the composition, but I can do so quickly enough.
"Then we place them."
Precisely… and the Corrupted won't know what hit them... because they'll be blinded with smoke.
In fact, I have two bombs I prepared as a test, if you're up for pushing through enemy lines and placing them.
"I can do that."
I knew you'd volunteer. I think those fortresses over there will do nicely. I'm sure you can find strategic locations inside.
I think that went rather well, don't you? Worry not about the trigger. I can handle that on my own when the time comes.
"They'll explode when we attack?"
This will be my contribution to the assault on Myrkgard: blinding any reinforcements that might harry you, and distracting those that can still see.
Now I know you entertain some strange company, but I must say this priest may be the strangest yet. He seems to be waiting for you.
I'm hoping if you talk to him, he'll soon be on his way… that man gives me chills.
I told you I'd find you again, Soulwarden, and here I am. We must speak, and soon.
You are a busy and respected person, I've come to realize. Fortunately, that makes you easier to find… as long as one moves fast!
Collect Corruption Pus at {POITags} to make Smoke Bombs
Destroy {targetName} to collect Corruption Pus
Defeat Corrupted
Bring collected pus to Sun Fuchun to create Smoke Bombs
Travel to {POITags} to place bombs
Place a Smoke Bomb
Travel to {POITags} to place bombs
Place a Smoke Bomb
Tell Sun you've placed the Smoke Bombs
To Prepare a Place For You

After much research, Father Russo has discovered what he believes is the means to achieve the Tempest's defeat and salvation. Search the depths of Illurmin Canyon for two Ancient Artifacts that he requires to craft a powerful spiritual weapon.
"And I saw a star fall from heaven upon the earth. And there was given to him the key of the bottomless pit."
"… is there some meaning in that?"
Don't you see? I've found what we need! Deep in the pits of this scarred canyon are Ancient objects of immense spiritual power.
If we can secure them, they can be used to subdue Isabella and re-open her mind so we may bring about her salvation.
"You still think you can save her?"
We must have faith, Soulwarden. There is no room for doubt. If you recover these artifacts, we will defeat Isabella. I promise.
I will retreat to a safe location with your allies, and await you there. You must trust me on this - it is the only way.
The end is coming. And our fates… the world's fate... will be decided.
I can't believe it. We've managed to amass quite a large and diverse force. I do not think the Tempest is prepared for this.
Remarkable. These artifacts are exactly what we needed. I feel as if I have awoken from a nightmare to bask in the morning sun.
Travel to {POITags} to collect the first artifact
Find the location of the first artifact
Deactivate the pillar to access the Artifact Chamber
Deactivate the pillar to access the Artifact Chamber
Travel through the barrier to collect the artifact
Collect {itemName}
Travel to {POITags} to collect the second artifact
Find the location of the the second artifact
Use the lever to access the Artifact Chamber
Travel through the barrier to collect the artifact
Collect the {itemName}
Take the artifacts back to Father Russo
A Time For Peace, A Time for War
On the eve of battle, the mood in the Soulwarden War Camp is grim. While Father Russo works to fashion his ultimate weapon, walk the camp and bolster the morale of your many allies.
Truly, I have not felt such hope and conviction in my heart since I first resolved to return here and face my sins.
"Let's put your plan to the test."
And so the ending does finally begin, the conclusion of a long saga that brought us to these shores.
Many have rallied to your banner, Soulwarden, but are they prepared for what is to come? Darkness will deepen before the dawn.
"I will ensure they're prepared."
You are a portrait of the courage and leadership Isabella herself once displayed. Divine power is given to the righteous.
Your pardon. These final steps will take the whole of my concentration. We will speak again shortly.
Greetings. It is my honor to assist the Soulwardens in this endeavor. May the Heavens smile on us.
We know our enemy, therefore we shall overcome. The outcome is already as predetermined as the battle.

string.comment: (Ancient groaning, a sigh as if from the depths of granite)
string.speaker: Bonesplitter
string.name: AncientBonesplitter

string.comment: (Ancient clattering, a breath as if from falling stones)
string.speaker: The Faceless Man
string.name: AncientFaceless

string.comment: (weird Blightwracked sounds croaking, barely intelligible)
string.speaker: Greenstalk
string.name: BlighterGreenstalk

resources.string: ::.Decimation upon umbral sunsets.::

string.comment: (weird Blightwracked sounds croaking, barely intelligible)
string.speaker: Blueshell
string.name: BlighterBlueshell

resources.string: ::.Earthquakes, the scent of pine, silence.::
We are with you, Warden, now until the end, come what may.
I wish Walker could be here, but he said he couldn't risk witnessing the loss of another Soulwarden…
To think we are here at the very gates of Myrkgard. The Tempest… is just over there…
I can't do this anymore. It was too much… and what if it happens again…?
I'll stay with you if you like. But if you ever want to go, we can do that too.
Ah, Soulwarden. You see our plan has come to fruition. Ancient Guardians are slow, but they respond to my command, nonetheless.
Continue
With luck, our assault against Myrkgard will be a swift matter. This sorcery requires great concentration. Not easy to maintain…
"Stay strong, we can do this."
Times like this, I think of my brother, and all that he endured, and now I think of Yonas too, and even that fool, Galahad.
There have been many sacrifices made to bring us this far… I will bear my share of the burden as well, with pride.
I think you're more confident in my abilities than I am… That's why I'm here, you know.
Here we are, standing in a war camp on the very precipice of battle. When we met in Brightwood, I never could've imagined this.
Continue
I have ever been one to linger in the background, the observer, but you have drawn out a new side of me. One that knows no fear.
"I take no credit. You earned it."
I did my part. Seeing Liang thrive after so many years of isolation has been a salve for my mind and spirit.
I still mourn the fall of Empress Zhou, but I also know she would have willingly endured any suffering to save her son.
"Yes, I suppose that's true."
The ending was bittersweet. But we did well by them both. And here, at the edge of this precipice, we shall do so again.
Thank you for speaking with me. It may not be my place to say so, but I think Yonas would be most proud of you.
Human, we… I have a question. We are Angry Earth. But I am not angry. Does this make me broken? A misshapen growth?
"No, your sense of self blooms."
Self? The Angry Earth are one, but we grow from dissimilar soil and in dissimilar ways. Perhaps I can be we, but also me.
My rootsister Myrtilus has always found joy in roaming free, independent in her thought, but I am just understanding now.
"I’m glad. And also for your help."
Yes, as are we and I. My brethren and sistren cannot rejoin the collective, but this gives them a sense of purpose. We are with you.
We will try to be as our rootsibling and find the "bow and arrows" within ourself. Lest she chide, calling us cotyledon.
Commander! All of our steps have brought us to this place at this time. We are all ready to attack on your orders.
"I appreciate it. Hold firm, Yash."
Oh, I will. I swear it! Never have I felt so inspired before. I simply wished to inspire you in case your morale falters.
"I will not lose heart."
If ever you do, trust in the symbol of our order. The blue of the sky! The white of the sun! Freedom for Aeternum!
"Honestly, Yash, I am confident."
Very well. Very well. You can confide in me later. Rest assured, I will be here. Call out to me whenever you have need.
You have got this, Warden. I believe in you. Fully. Without hesitation.
I have something for you, Soulwarden, when you are ready.
It is done. A masterwork, had I the luxury of the sin of pride. For your Azoth Staff - a means to achieve Isabella's redemption.
With this augmentation, you will have the power to destroy her darkness and send it back to the oblivion from whence it came!
Prepare your allies for the upcoming battle:
Discuss battle plans with Morgaine
Check in with Phaeris
Raise Sun's spirits
Bolster Yash's confidence
Walls Came Tumbling Down
The time has come to strike at the heart of Corruption. As the vanguard of the Soulwardens and their newfound allies, assault Myrkgard and overthrow the Tempest's dominion.
You have triumphed over countless Corrupted, but do not be overconfident. Isabella is more formidable than ever.
"Thank you. I am prepared."
I do not know if one can ever be prepared for something like this. Facing such darkness is beyond mortal comprehension. But…
We have seen the goodness that still hides in Isabella's soul. That is the path to our victory… and her redemption, God willing.
I will follow wherever you lead, Soulwarden, and say a prayer for the souls of us all.
It is only fitting that you signal the start of battle. Raise the Soulwarden Banner on high when you are ready.
A barrier protects the portal! It seems to be as strong as the Stormwall. We've tried everything, but we cannot breach it.
Didn't I tell you? I'm nothing if not full of surprises… I think this artifact might get the job done.
There you go, my friend, a clear path to the heart of evil. Let's finish this thing and go to the pub!
You've achieved nothing but more suffering for your companions! Even now, I am opening portals throughout Myrkgard.
Well, I never thought I'd see the day when you looked stumped, but here it is! Are you going to say something or just stand there?
"Grace! I thought you sailed away."
I won't lie - I was sorely tempted, but I decided a joyride along the coast was enough. Beside, I knew you'd be needing me.
And I was right as rain! If I hadn't turned back with that artifact, you'd be high and dry. I think you'll owe me one for this.
"A debt I take on with pleasure."
And don't think I won't be taking you up on it! For now, let's just blast these bastards. We can discuss my compensation later.
Looks like those fellows need an extra gun downstairs. Luckily, I have two!
I have learned much through your eyes and your ears. You cannot touch me. My destiny is my own to decide.
The evil permeating this blasphemous cathedral has a taste.
The evil permeating this blasphemous cathedral has a taste. Only divine judgment can purge its foulness from existence.
Rally at the Soulwarden's Banner
Blow the horn to rally the troops
Travel to {POITags}
Charge through Myrkgard as the Soulwarden Vanguard
(Optional) Tear down Corrupted Flags and replace them with Soulwarden Banners
Change the banner to guide the other Soulwardens
Pick one:
Destroy the western Corrupted Monolith
Destroy the eastern Corrupted Monolith
Discover the location of the Corrupted Portal
Defeat the Corrupted Portal
Listen to the rallying voices of your allies
Listen to the words of Isabella
Find Grace O'Malley on the road to Myrkgard Cathedral
Thank Grace for her help clearing the way
Continue up the path to reach Myrkgard Cathedral
Prodigal Daughter

The Tempest has been backed into a corner and has nowhere to retreat now except for within herself. Before she is able to open more Corruption Portals throughout Aeternum, use Father Russo's weapon to enter her mind and face her in combat for the last time.
Steel yourself, Soulwarden. You stand upon the threshold of Corruption's heart. It may as well be the Gates of Hell itself.
"What's she doing?"
That is how I found her… secure within the depths of her own mind, commanding Corruption by thought alone.
She is impervious, physically. It was wise that we came with another strategy prepared. Your Azoth Staff! Use it to enter her mind.
"I will need help. You know her."
I will attempt to join you if possible, and together we will grapple with her very soul. Beware! You go to her true domain.
I will attempt to join you if possible, and together we will grapple with her very soul. Beware! You go to her true domain.
In the heart of the mountain, you will grapple with her very soul. Beware! You go to her true domain.
The power you wield… I fear it will destroy her utterly. Though I know not what darkness may be unleashed from such an event…
"So be it."
Do not strike her down with vengeance in your heart. I know what comes of that. Let your staff be the instrument of divine mercy.
Isabella de Leon was innocent and brave at one time, and I believe that person is still in there… waiting to be set free.
"That part is beyond my power."
And so we surrender our fates to this battle and this purpose, beyond our understanding. "Into thy hands I commend my spirit." Amen.

string.comment: (Whispering to himself, tearfully)
string.speaker: Father Russo
string.name: FatherRusso

resources.string: "If I shall go and prepare a place for you, I will come again and will take you to myself: that where I am, you also may be."
Nearly got this whole thing finished!

string.comment: (Whispering to himself, tearfully)
string.speaker: Father Russo
string.name: FatherRusso

resources.string: "If I shall go and prepare a place for you, I will come again and will take you to myself: that where I am, you also may be."
How dare you assault me in this place! And how foolish. In here, I am like unto a god! Who is able to make war against me!?
You move so sluggishly!
So sluggish!
I am over here. Am I too quick for you?
Am I too quick?
Keep your distance!
Such an unworthy opponent…
That you thought you could do anything to stop me…
Insolent!
And they shall fall before the might of destiny!
Fall before destiny!
Stand still and die!
Submit to me!
I will overcome you!
You cannot keep dodging me forever.
You cannot run forever.
You fight well, insolent as you are. But I draw from a power you can't begin to fathom!
Fool! I draw from a power you can't begin to fathom!
And so it imbues even my memories with power. I salute you, Alvaro!
I salute your sacrifice, Alvaro!
Oh no, it does not end like this. Corruption transmutes my past pain into power!
Corruption turns my pain into power!
Once more I remember you and live again, Ruiz!
I remember you and live again, Ruiz!
A pathetic resistance. Do you not see how outmatched you are? I am not alone!
You are outmatched; I am not alone!
All of you! Lend me your aid! Together we overcome this reprobate!
All of you! Lend me your aid!
And now comes the time in which you offer your life to me as well.
Now offer your soul to me…
One day I will remember you… your existence… your futile struggle…
One day I will remember you…
And I shall laugh.
Isabella... you must stop this madness. The Corruption deceives you. We are not your enemy.
Old fool, you're a remnant of a lesser life. You know nothing. You never did.
I will not give up on you. Recall the words that once inspired your faith…
That the only truth in this fallen world is the bond of one heart to another!
Then why did you abandon me, Father!?

string.comment: I really liked our previous select of this, but during the session it might be good to get this again and see if we can plus it up.
string.speaker: Isabella de Leon
string.name: Isabella

resources.string: (Enraged, primal screaming)

string.comment: I also really liked our previous select of this, but during the session it might be good to get this again and see if we can plus it up.
string.speaker: Father Russo
string.name: FatherRusso

resources.string: (Cry of agony)
And so the tide of Crimson rolled back, reared up, and crashed upon the unbelieving masses with the Water of Life.
And so the tide of Crimson crashed upon the unbelieving masses with the Water of Life.
"Drink of me freely!" she said. "I am of the divine humanity."
"Through me is the way to the city of peace; through me is the way to joy eternal; through me is the way to the found above."
"Through me is the way to the city of peace; joy eternal; the found above."
"I was birthed by earthly power, human wisdom, and love inherent."
"I was birthed by earthly power, human wisdom, and freedom primordial."
"Before me no godly things were. Save those mortal, and mortal I abide."
"Abandon all despair, ye who enter here!"
Witness the holy retribution of my sanctuary!
Stay with me here… Forever.
Abide with me here… Forever.
(Power-mad laughter)
No… I was to be the savior…
Why have you forsaken me…
After all this time… am I still… truly… alone…?
Am I not… safe from you…
Even in my own mind?
Gah!
Uh!
I am trying... to release you all... from the lie!
Ah!
Don't you see...
No one is watching over us.
There is no god.
We are alone...
Each of us…
…in the end.
Guh, gah, ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh!
Done and dusted!
A bit disappointed I couldn't land the last blow. But in a manner of thinking… maybe I did!
Confront Isabella
Venture into the mind of Isabella
Delve deeper into Isabella's memories
Defeat Isabella
Tell Grace what happened
The First Things Have Passed Away

Corruption has been weakened and its loudest voice has been silenced: the Tempest is gone. Find Father Russo to understand what will become of Aeternum in the passing of this storm, and celebrate the victory with your allies.
Well! No need to selfishly take all the credit. This was a shared victory, you and me. Look at us! Come a long way, we have!
"I'm happy you came back, Grace."
Bah! What choice did you leave me with? It's been a lifetime since we met on that beach; I couldn't just sail away.
Besides, I would've missed all the craziness! Like the end of days, it was! I can't believe it all blew over.
"Where is Father Russo?"
Can't say as I know anyone by the name. Clergy type? Nope, it was just me here when I got back from the fight.
Anyhow, what's it matter? You won! Tell you what, finish up here, meet me at the pub in Oxboro. Have ourselves a chat.
Off with you now! Don't worry, your Grace will be sticking around. That's a promise, that is!

As the Soulwarden and Isabella knelt before each other, there was a silence unlike any I have ever known. It reminded me of the first time I administered Holy Communion: the silent acknowledge of Divine Love. But the moment ended abruptly. Here in this foul place, that silence has been shattered forever. It is accomplished and the tomb is empty… but She is not here. She is not here. She is not here. There is no redemption.
And so it came to pass that the Heart of the Tempest was abandoned by the power for which she traded everything.
Her body consumed in holy light… and her tainted soul ripped into the depths of the mountain.
The Soulwardens are victorious. Aeternum, and the world, pulled back from the precipice of doom.
But at what cost…
So many of their numbers Lost or Corrupted.
While the factions ignore their sacrifice and continue their petty struggles for dominance.
And what of the pain and sacrifice that was forced upon the Angry Earth?
It will become clear soon enough that the vengeful hand of nature will grasp far more than equilibrium.
And the void exposed when the surge in Corruption abates will become a threat in itself…
… as the soulless remnants of this conflict rise from the battlefield to find purpose and power in a source as yet unrealized.
Yea, though the hapless inhabitants of Aeternum soon will learn this chapter may have come to a close,
the real horrors have just begun.
(Dark laughter)
We have done the impossible! Yonas is avenged. And now he can rest, though his spirit will live on. In all of us.
Commanding the Ancient Guardians... that was a heady experience! And, I fear, addictive. I hope never to wield such power again.
Liang will be overjoyed to hear of this rousing success! Perhaps now we can know a second peace – and one to last a long, long time.
We remained behind to bid you farewells. Human! Be well! The Huntress calls us back to the garden in convocation. We go to listen.
You made it!
I'm half-surprised you're here, not that you'd let me down, but I've noticed you never take a moment for yourself. It's unhealthy.
Talk to Grace and celebrate the Soulwarden's monumental victory
You made it!
Continue
I'm half-surprised you're here, not that you'd let me down, but I've noticed you never take a moment for yourself. It's unhealthy.
"To health, then, and victory!"
Cheers, indeed! Though now I'm to be a wee hypocrite, as I'm myself off on a new little… venture. Can't say too much, really…
But the usual: plenty of coin to be had, and thrills, and excitement, and some modicum of danger. I might consider a partner…
"Either way, we'll meet again."
Of course we will! I have that ship I always wanted now, so I have. Don't you just love it when a barmy plan comes together?
By the way, caught a snippet of an interesting rumor. Corrupted Roman Legions in the desert! Can you imagine?
"Some sun would be a nice change."
Hey, it's your adventure! Anyhow, we'll be seeing you, hero, somewhere out in that great vasty island of opportunity!
Read Father Russo's final note
Read the Book of Isabella
Search for signs of Father Russo back at his campsite
(Optional) Return to the camp to let everyone know how the battle went
Meet Grace in the Tavern in Oxboro
Talk with Grace about all that transpired
Travel to Brimstone Sands to begin a new adventure
Now that I have revealed the truth about Corruption, about our birthright, what is your choice…?

string.comment: A hint of 'Good Isabella'. This is perhaps a vision of who should could have become as a Paladin. She speaks to, and is conscious of, the player.
string.speaker: Isabella de Leon
string.name: Isabella

resources.string: I… can see you now. You were the light and… Ahhh. Now I understand!

string.comment: A hint of 'Good Isabella'. This is perhaps a vision of who should could have become as a Paladin.
string.speaker: Isabella de Leon
string.name: Isabella

resources.string: You who must now go forth in my stead to this place of darkness… I salute your resolve.

string.comment: A hint of 'Good Isabella'. This is perhaps a vision of who should could have become as a Paladin. She salutes the player.
string.speaker: Isabella de Leon
string.name: Isabella

resources.string: Vaya con Dios!

string.comment: A hint of 'Good Isabella'. This is perhaps a vision of who should could have become as a Paladin. She salutes the player.
string.speaker: Isabella de Leon
string.name: Isabella

resources.string: Go with God!
I am lost in the dark... I cannot find my way… Is this Hell…?
(Frightened breathing)
Why did I ever leave her? That poor fallen Angel… left alone on an island of the damned…
If Divine Love could not save us, what could mortal love possibly accomplish? Oh, Isabella, my dearest companion…
I am so very sorry.
I loved you so very much.
"And God shall wipe away all tears from their eyes: and death shall be no more… The first things have passed away."
